meanings.definition: A quantity of goods produced at one time
meanings.sent1: The baker made a fresh batch of cookies for the party.
meanings.sent2: The factory packaged a large batch of toys for shipping.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the entire batch of dough on the floor!
meanings.sent4: The students were like a batch of eager bees, buzzing around the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the new batch of bread filled the bakery with warmth and comfort.

meanings.definition: A group of items processed or dealt with together
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist prepared a batch of prescriptions for the patients.
meanings.sent2: The IT department received a batch of new laptops for distribution.
meanings.sent3: The kids formed a batch of colorful crayons to share with each other.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together like a well-oiled batch of gears in a machine.
meanings.sent5: The gardeners planted a fresh batch of flowers to brighten up the park.

meanings.definition: A collection of things or persons to be handled together
meanings.sent1: The teacher organized a batch of books for the school library.
meanings.sent2: The event planner arranged a batch of chairs for the conference room.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to cook a batch of meals for their camping trip.
meanings.sent4: The orchestra played in perfect harmony, like a batch of musical notes.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers sorted through a large batch of donated clothes for the charity drive.
